definitions:
"consumer prices index": the all items consumer prices index published by the Statistics Board.
"pre-2026 claimant": a claimant with limited capability for work and work-related activity who was entitled to an award of universal credit that included the LCWRA element before 6 April 2026 and has been continuously entitled since.
"relevant CPI percentage": the percentage by which the consumer prices index for the September before the start of the tax year is higher than it was for the September before that (or 0% if it is not higher).
"relevant evidence": evidence to suggest that a determination was made in ignorance of, or based on a mistake as to, some material fact, or that there has been a relevant change of circumstances in relation to the claimant’s physical or mental condition.
"relevant power": the power in section 9(2) of the Welfare Reform Act 2012, or the power in section 150(2)(b) of the Social Security Administration Act 1992.
"severe conditions criteria claimant": a claimant who has limited capability for work and work-related activity, and at least one of the descriptors in Schedule 7 constantly applies to them for the rest of their life.
"tax year": the 12 months beginning with 6 April in any year.
"the standard allowance": the allowance to be included in an award of universal credit under section 9(1) of the Welfare Reform Act 2012.
responsibilities: The Secretary of State must exercise a relevant power to ensure the amounts of the standard allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 are at least the amounts calculated in accordance with the Act. The Department for Communities in Northern Ireland has a corresponding duty for Northern Ireland.
eligibility: A claimant is a "pre-2026 claimant" if they were entitled to an award of universal credit that included the LCWRA element at any time before 6 April 2026 and have been continuously entitled to it since. A claimant is a "severe conditions criteria claimant" if it has been determined that they have limited capability for work and work-related activity and at least one of the descriptors set out in Schedule 7 constantly applies to them for the rest of their life, arising from a diagnosed specific bodily or mental disease or disablement.
payments: The amounts of the standard allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 are to be calculated by taking the previous year's amount, increasing it by the relevant CPI percentage, and then increasing it by a relevant uplift percentage (2.3% for 2026-27, 3.1% for 2027-28, 4.0% for 2028-29, and 4.8% for 2029-30). For the tax year 2026-27, a new LCWRA element of £217.26 is introduced for claimants other than pre-2026 claimants, severe conditions criteria claimants, or terminally ill claimants. The LCWRA and LCW elements will not be up-rated for the tax years ending 5 April 2026 to 5 April 2029. The protected LCWRA amount combined with the standard allowance must be increased by at least the relevant CPI percentage for the tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30.
